content: Password Reset Guide: To reset your password, navigate to Settings > Security > Change Password. You will need to verify your email address first. If you have two-factor authentication enabled, you will also need your authenticator app. The new password must be at least 12 characters with one uppercase letter, one number, and one special character. Password changes take effect immediately across all active sessions. If you are locked out of your account, contact support@example.com with your account ID for manual verification. The verification process typically takes 1-2 business days. Note: Password reset links expire after 15 minutes for security. If your link has expired, request a new one from the login page.

API Rate Limits and Error Codes: Error E-4012 means your API key has expired. Generate a new key at dashboard.example.com/api-keys. Error E-4013 means you've exceeded your rate limit of 1000 requests per minute. Implement exponential backoff starting at 1 second. Error E-4014 indicates an invalid request format — check your JSON payload against the schema at docs.example.com/api/schema. Error E-4015 means the requested resource was not found. Error E-4016 indicates a server-side timeout — retry after 5 seconds. All API errors return a JSON response with 'error_code', 'message', and 'retry_after' fields. For batch operations, individual item failures are reported in the 'errors' array while successful items are in the 'results' array.

Billing FAQ: We offer three plans — Starter ($29/mo, up to 10k API calls), Professional ($99/mo, up to 100k API calls, priority support), and Enterprise (custom pricing, unlimited calls, dedicated infrastructure, SLA). All plans include a 14-day free trial with full Professional features. You can upgrade or downgrade at any time — changes take effect at the next billing cycle. Refunds are available within 30 days of purchase. Annual billing saves 20% on any plan. Enterprise customers get dedicated support, custom SLA, and a designated account manager. To view or update your billing details, go to Settings > Billing > Payment Methods. We accept Visa, Mastercard, American Express, and wire transfer for Enterprise plans.

Webhook Configuration Guide: Webhooks allow your application to receive real-time notifications when events occur. Supported events: user.created, user.updated, user.deleted, payment.completed, payment.failed, subscription.changed. To configure webhooks, go to Settings > Developers > Webhooks. Each webhook URL must respond with a 200 status within 5 seconds. Failed deliveries are retried 3 times with exponential backoff (1s, 10s, 100s). After 3 failures, the webhook is disabled and you receive an email notification. Webhook payloads are signed with HMAC-SHA256 using your webhook secret. Always verify the signature before processing. Example verification code is available in our SDKs for Python, Node.js, Go, and Ruby.

Single Sign-On (SSO) Setup: Enterprise plan customers can configure SAML 2.0 or OIDC-based SSO for their organization. Supported identity providers: Okta, Azure AD, Google Workspace, OneLogin, and any SAML 2.0 compliant provider. To set up SSO: 1) Navigate to Settings > Organization > SSO. 2) Choose your protocol (SAML or OIDC). 3) Enter your IdP metadata URL or upload the metadata XML. 4) Map your IdP attributes to our user fields (email, firstName, lastName, role). 5) Test the connection with a sandbox user before enabling for all members. Once enabled, users can log in via the SSO portal at login.example.com/sso/your-org-slug. Non-SSO login can be optionally disabled for all organization members except administrators.

Data Export and Compliance: All customers can export their data at any time via Settings > Data > Export. Export formats available: JSON (complete), CSV (tabular data only), and PDF (reports). Full exports for accounts with over 100k records are processed asynchronously — you will receive a download link via email within 24 hours. For GDPR data subject requests, use the dedicated endpoint POST /api/v2/gdpr/data-request with the subject's email. This returns all stored data within 72 hours. For data deletion requests, use DELETE /api/v2/gdpr/delete-request. Deletion is irreversible and propagates to all backups within 30 days. SOC 2 Type II and ISO 27001 compliance reports are available upon request for Enterprise customers.

Troubleshooting Slow API Responses: If you experience API latency above 500ms, check the following: 1) Verify your request includes only necessary fields — large payloads increase processing time. 2) Use pagination (limit/offset) for list endpoints instead of fetching all records. 3) Check our status page at status.example.com for any ongoing incidents. 4) If using webhooks, ensure your endpoint responds quickly — slow webhook handlers can cause cascading delays. 5) For search endpoints, use filters to narrow results before fetching. 6) Consider upgrading to Professional or Enterprise for dedicated infrastructure with lower latency. Current average response times: Starter (avg 200ms, p99 800ms), Professional (avg 100ms, p99 400ms), Enterprise (avg 50ms, p99 200ms, dedicated instances).
